column4: hey, I'm trying to restart my X session as it's frozen, but restarting GDM hasn't done anything and I can't find a useful pid to kill. what can i do besides rebooting?
any way i can do this through ssh?
i tried t.t
any other ways?
did you sudo restart gdm?
i didn't sudo, i logged in as root, i know i know :P
you need to be on the tty where x is on
'k' Secure Access Key (SAK) Kills all programs on the current virtual console.
http://www.debian-administration.org/articles/457
if this doesn't work your system has crashed.
but i can ssh into it?
then sysreq have to work
i don't suppose you run a custom kernel?
then your doing sth. wrong
alt + sysreq + k. try it again :-)
oh yeah. the key may not work. but sysreqs are the last thing that stop working
well, anyways, do you have any suggestions what could be causing this crashing?
because i can't find any suggestive feedback as to what could be doing it
check the log files
yeah i know, but so much logs, i dont know which ones i should check first
what does crashing mean exactly. does x freeze?
then these files /var/log/Xorg*
